forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Cloudy. Low around 50, with temperatures rising to around 52 overnight. South southeast wind around 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Mostly cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. South wind around 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
Awakening to a soft haze, Downtown San Francisco carries an air of quiet anticipation this morning. The clouds hang low, intertwined with the scent of potential rain, casting a gentle gray over the familiar skyline. With a brisk wind nudging along at about nine miles per hour, the chill nips through the layers, urging a touch of warmth in your attire—a light jacket or a cozy sweater will serve you well against the cool air, especially as the temperature drops slightly throughout the day.

As the hours pass, a whisper of rain continues to linger, teasing the possibility of a sprinkle here and there. The forecast suggests a 40% chance of precipitation, but no deluge is expected—perhaps a light mist will grace the streets, paving the way for a quiet reflection amid the urban bustle. There’s a somber beauty today; the clouds, heavy yet poetic, cradle the city in a soft embrace, perfect for an afternoon spent browsing tucked-away bookstores or wandering through dimly lit cafés with a warm drink in hand. Plan for an evening stroll, where the city lights gently pierce the marine layer, offering glimpses of a hidden charm beneath the mist.
